title: NFL 2019: Tom Brady accidental troll, Robert Kraft, massage parlour, Netflix, Living with Yourself
text:
Take a look at some of the highlights of Super Bowl LIII, from the game, halftime entertainment and the Patriots victory.

A blink-and-you’d-miss-it cameo from Tom Brady in new Netflix show Living with Yourself has dragged the NFL superstar into a uncomfortable position.

The show, which stars Paul Rudd as a middle-aged man disenfranchised with life before he visits a mysterious spa for a treatment promising him a better life, only for — spoilers, although not really as it’s in the trailer for the show — his life to be taken over by a doppelganger.

But the six-time Super Bowl champion makes his cameo in the first episode, stepping out of the spa with a big smile on his face in an accidentally hilarious scene.

Stream Live & On-Demand coverage of the 2019/20 NFL Season with ESPN on KAYO SPORTS. Get your 14-day free trial and start streaming instantly >

“First time?” Brady asks. Paul Rudd’s character nervously agreed and replies, “You?”

Brady responds “six”.

It appears to be referring to Brady’s six NFL titles.

Or it would have been had the owner of Brady’s New England Patriots Robert Kraft not been caught on camera and charged in a prostitution sting at a massage parlour in January.

The New York Post reported at the time that the 77-year-old billionaire allegedly spent 11 minutes with a masseuse who greeted him with a hug, fondled him “and then put her head down by” his crotch the morning of January 20 — the same day as the AFC Championship game against the Kansas City Chiefs.

It then became a tourist attraction for NFL fans who hate the Patriots.

Brady was furious when asked about the cameo in the show, especially when it was written four years earlier and he had agreed to do the cameo a year ago.

Tom Brady answers questions about his cameo on a Netflix show and he wasn’t happy. pic.twitter.com/WpI7mrfGJy — Mike Reiss (@MikeReiss) October 19, 2019

“That’s not what it was about, I think that was taken out of context,” Brady said. “It was meant to be something different than that. The fact that it’s a distraction and you’re bringing it up is not something I want to be talking about.”

The US media were all over the story, with US Today saying it spoofed Kraft and Brady took aim at the “blame and shame” culture of the media.

Brady said it was shot on a green screen and he said it was wasn’t about Kraft’s situation.

“It’s unfortunate that people would choose to think that I would ever do something like that about Mr. Kraft,” Brady said. “I think that’s a very bad assessment of my relationship with him. I would never do that.

“I think everybody knows what our relationship is about. For 20 years, it’s nothing but love and respect. I’ve been through a lot of tough things with him and I love him dearly. I sympathise with a lot of things he’s gone through in his life.”

Social media was quick to laugh at the cameo but Brady had plenty of defenders, with some claiming producers “did Brady dirty”.

Has been explained to me that the green screen was indeed used in that parking lot. Seems like the creators of this show did Brady dirty. And got what they wanted: tons of publicity. https://t.co/pJGvvHeKxg — Michael Giardi (@MikeGiardi) October 19, 2019

Watched “Living With Yourself” ... the Brady joke fit in with the script and was really funny. They didn’t create a spa to make a Kraft joke. Was central part of the whole plot. If Brady wasn’t in front of the spa it wouldn’t have made sense. https://t.co/htvS2V71Nj — Andrew Perloff (@andrewperloff) October 20, 2019

Tom Brady got totally porked by the Netflix people. Totally unfair to him and Robert Kraft. https://t.co/fM614A2lKc — Jared Stillman (@JaredStillman) October 19, 2019

Brady is the 🐐. His scene was hilarious. I totally get it was written well before any Kraft stuff. But how he could blame the media or think people associating a massage parlor storefront scene with current events with his owner is silly. https://t.co/RgWy4DGDpv — Will Manso (@WillManso) October 19, 2019

Earlier this week, series director Timothy Greenberg said in an interview with Refinery29 that the scene wasn’t filmed until the Patriots season ended, which it did on the back of another Super Bowl win.

It also means that Kraft’s incident had already been in the news and Greenberg admitted he thought Brady would pull out of the shoot because the parlour Kraft was caught at “looked almost exactly like what we were shooting.”

“Like, I would have used it as a reference photo,” Greenberg said of the massage parlour from Kraft’s story. “So we’re like, ‘Alright, this is clearly not going to happen now’.”
description: A blink-and-you’d-miss-it cameo from Tom Brady in new Netflix show Living with Yourself has dragged the NFL superstar into a uncomfortable position.
